SENT.plain: 32 patients with Marfan syndrome, diagnosed with DePaepe's criteria, volunteered for this study
All patients underwent standard anteroposterior radiographs of the lumbar spine
Interpediculate distances (IPD) at each level were compared to those of previously established norms
Criteria were developed to determine the presence of Marfan using "cut-off values" for the IPDs at each lumbar level
The IPDs were significantly larger in the Marfan patients at all lumbar levels
Cut-off values were calculated setting the specificity at 95% at each lumbar level
The cut-off value at L4 yielded the greatest sensitivity
We conclude that the IPDs are widened in patients with Marfan syndrome
The IPD at L4 is a good criterion for Marfan with specificity of 95% and sensitivity of 75%
One must consider using this as a skeletal criterion or a screening tool for Marfan
